title: 'I lost 9st playing Pokémon Go': how the viral app turned into a health boon for a generation of gamers
text:
Cast your mind back to July 2016. There was one subject on everybody’s lips and surprisingly, it wasn’t the result of the recent Brexit referendum: Pokémon.

The cause of the newly renewed Pokémania was Pokémon Go, an augmented reality smartphone game which saw players walking around outdoors, hunting for virtual creatures which appeared in the app.

Suddenly it seemed like every man and his dog was sorting his Charmanders from his Squirtles. At its height, Pokémon Go was being played by an astonishing 28.5m people per day, surpassing Snapchat, Tinder, Twitter, Instagram, and even Facebook at one point.
